messages.content: What is ComfyUI-LivePortrait?
ComfyUI-LivePortrait is a version of LivePortrait implemented for the ComfyUI platform, which allows generating dynamic portraits from static images and driving videos.
Does ComfyUI-LivePortrait support multiple faces and different animations for each face?
Yes, ComfyUI-LivePortrait supports multiple faces and allows specifying different animations for each face.
What is the purpose of the Face Crop Info node in ComfyUI-LivePortrait?
The Face Crop Info node is used to extract face cropping information from an image, which helps specify the cropping area for faces in the image.
What are the adjustable parameters in the Face Crop Info node?

The adjustable parameters in the Face Crop Info node include face_sorting_direction (left-right or large-small), face_index (specifies which face to process, default is -1 for all detected faces), and debug (enables or disables debug mode).
What is the purpose of the Retargeting node in ComfyUI-LivePortrait?
The Retargeting node allows enabling or disabling eye and lip driving in the generated dynamic portraits.
Where should the models be placed for ComfyUI-LivePortrait?
The models for ComfyUI-LivePortrait should be placed in the following directories: 'Comfyui/models/liveportrait' and 'Comfyui/models/insightface'.
Is it necessary to install additional dependencies if ComfyUI-Mixlab-Nodes is already installed?
No, if ComfyUI-Mixlab-Nodes is already installed, there is no need to install additional dependencies for ComfyUI-LivePortrait.
What are some related plugins recommended for use with ComfyUI-LivePortrait?
Some related plugins recommended for use with ComfyUI-LivePortrait include Comfyui-ChatTTS, comfyui-sound-lab, comfyui-Image-reward, comfyui-ultralytics-yolo, and comfyui-moondream.
What is LivePortrait?

LivePortrait is an official PyTorch implementation of the paper 'LivePortrait: Efficient Portrait Animation with Stitching and Retargeting Control'. It is a repo that contains the code for efficient portrait animation using stitching and retargeting control.
Who are the authors of the LivePortrait paper?
The authors of the LivePortrait paper are Jianzhu Guo, Dingyun Zhang, Xiaoqiang Liu, Zhizhou Zhong, Yuan Zhang, Pengfei Wan, and Di Zhang.
How can I get started with using LivePortrait?

To get started with LivePortrait, you need to clone the code from the GitHub repository, prepare the environment, download pretrained weights, and follow the inference steps provided in the documentation.
What are the pretrained weights required for LivePortrait?

The pretrained weights required for LivePortrait include the face detection models of InsightFace and the LivePortrait weights. These can be downloaded from the provided Google Drive or Baidu Yun links.
How can I evaluate the inference speed of each module in LivePortrait?
To evaluate the inference speed of each module in LivePortrait, you can run the provided speed.py script.
What is the purpose of the Gradio interface in LivePortrait?

The Gradio interface in LivePortrait is provided for a better user experience, allowing users to interact with the model through a web interface. However, it is currently a work in progress and will be upgraded soon.
How can I cite the LivePortrait paper in my research?
To cite the LivePortrait paper in your research, you can use the provided BibTeX entry in the documentation.
